commText: Arjun Tendulkar to Bhuvneshwar, B0$ Caught by Rohit!! And taken at cover! I0$ B1$ The moment Rohit took the catch he pointed his finger towards Arjun and ran towards him in elation. That shows he had faith in Tendulkar junior. Well we have seen it before. Tendulkar under pressure and he has delivered in his first real test. MI have won this by 14 runs. That was a fuller ball, the bat face twisted a little and was taken at cover. B2$

formatValue: Bhuvneshwar c Rohit b Arjun Tendulkar 2(5)
First scalp for Arjun in IPL.

commText: Arjun Tendulkar to Abdul Samad, B0$ Abdul Samad Run Out!! 1 run completed. That should be it! Junior Tendulkar and MI would be relieved now. Low full toss, outside off, Abdul Samad slices it and fails to come back for the second. That was again well executed. The batter should have put in the quick yards but failed to. The keeper received the throw and whipped the bails off. B1$

formatValue: Abdul Samad run out (Hrithik Shokeen/Ishan Kishan) 9(12) [4s-1]

commText: Behrendorff to Abdul Samad, B0$, fuller length delivery angled in, Abdul Samad opens the bat face and steers it past the man at short third for a four. That was well placed indeed. B1$

formatValue: 24 needed now. 19 runs off the over

commText: Behrendorff to Washington Sundar, B0$ Washington Sundar Run Out!! That was a fuller ball, right up there and Washington Sundar drilled it to mid-off. The fielder had a shy and got the direct hit in. The batter initially put in the big strides but then slowed down at the end thinking the ball might hit him and not the sticks. But the ball hit the sticks and he was well short in the end. Sundar and SRH would be shattered. B1$
Behrendorff to Washington Sundar, B0$, and Sundar has kept the hopes alive. Backs away, gives room and slices the shot between short third and point for a four. That was well placed

Behrendorff to Washington Sundar, B0$, misses the yorker by a huge margin. That was a poor delivery. Full toss, outside off and Washington Sundar lofts it over cover for a four. Poor ball and put away. SRH still in this

Meredith to Washington Sundar, 1 run, I0$Slower ball, angled across, Washington Sundar chips that down to mid-off for a single. There was no one inside the circle else it would have been a simple catch

Meredith to Marco Jansen, B0$ Caught by Tim David!! The slower ball banged in, Marco Jansen was a little too early into the pull and the man at long-on takes an easy catch. Was a back of a length delivery and Marco Jansen failed to connect properly on it. The cameo needed to be a little bigger. Good change up ball and the batter wasn't expecting that. Meredith has delivered another important wicket. B1$

formatValue: Marco Jansen c Tim David b Meredith 13(6) [4s-3]

commText: Meredith to Marco Jansen, B0$, and that's an important four. Meredith was nailing the yorkers. This time misses the mark, Marco Jansen stays leg-side of the ball and lofts it down the ground for a four. Was timed so well. Almost went the distance

Green to Marco Jansen, B0$, beats the man at short third, beats the man at deep point for a four. That was a fuller ball, outside off, Marco Jansen backed away and cue-ended it with an open face of the bat. The ball raced down fine for a four. 50 needed now off the last four overs
Green to Marco Jansen, B0$, stays leg-side of the fuller ball, drags it down the ground and beats the dive from the man at long-off. That was a fuller ball, Marco Jansen backed away and smoked it

Meredith to Mayank, B0$ Caught by Tim David!! Was a fuller ball, angled in and David takes it at long-on running to his right. That was there to be hit away but he failed to get enough distance on it. SRH lose the set batter. He would be gutted. SRH would be disappointed as well. That wasn't a great ball and the pick up shot off the pads wasn't timed that well. Not enough power either. B1$

formatValue: Mayank c Tim David b Meredith 48(41) [4s-4 6s-1]

commText: Chawla to Klaasen, B0$ Caught by Tim David!! And falls to the googly. One shot too many. You live by the sword and you die by it as well. Dragged his length a little, Klaasen went back and looked to power it down the ground. The ball went off the bottom part of the bat and skied up. The fielder initially came in but then back tracked to take it. Good catch in the end. MI will be elated. Klaasen was taking the game away. B1$

formatValue: Klaasen c Tim David b Chawla 36(16) [4s-4 6s-2]

commText: Chawla to Klaasen, B0$, and goes back to slam the pull past mid-wicket for a four. That was dropped short, Klaasen went back and power it wide of deep mid-wicket

Chawla to Klaasen, B0$, reverse swept for a sixer! This man is actually Hercules. Waits on that tossed up delivery and takes it from the sticks to send it over point. Was hit really well. Klaasen is turning it on
Chawla to Klaasen, B0$, and goes down town! That's a massive six. He is tearing into Chawla. Was a seam up fuller ball and Klaasen went down the ground to clear the fence by a long long way
Chawla to Klaasen, B0$, wow! That's a reverse hack and gets it over point. Managed to get a lot of bat on it

Green to Mayank, leg byes, 1 run, was a fuller ball, angled in, Mayank shuffled across and missed the clip. The ball went off the pads and they got a single. But the bowler kept on appealing and the keeper joined in as well. Both seemed confident and Rohit played along as well. But MI have ended up losing a review. That seemed a poor call and it has ensured MI have lost both their reviews...

Green to Klaasen, B0$, and scooped over short fine for a four. Wonderful execution. Was a slower length delivery at the sticks, Klaasen waits on it and scoops it at the very last moment. That pause helped the batter. He saw it till the end. I0$

formatValue: The ton is up for SRH

commText: Chawla to Mayank, B0$, fuller length delivery, wider, Mayank has drilled it after dancing down the track. Was a quicker ball again but the timing was serene from Mayank
Meredith to Klaasen, B0$, wow! Stroked so well. Lovely sound of the bat. Got into position quickly and pulled it over mid-wicket for a four. His good form has to come good today for SRH

Meredith to Mayank, B0$, flat-batted whack down the ground for a four. Was a short ball, Mayank backed away and spanked it down the ground. Meredith welcomed back with a four. Not that bad a ball but put away

Chawla to Abhishek Sharma, B0$ Caught by Tim David!! That's a soft dismissal. A googly, well tossed up and Abhishek Sharma just chips it inside out to find the man at long-off. Chawla has another wicket. Perhaps the easiest one in this tourney. David also picked up a simple catch. SRH have imploded a little. Sharma would be gutted. SRH needed better from Sharma after the fall of their skipper. This will dent their chances big time. B1$

formatValue: Abhishek Sharma c Tim David b Chawla 1(2)

commText: Green to Markram, B0$ Caught by Hrithik Shokeen!! That's a wicket against the run of play. Was a short ball, Markram went for the pull and this time found the fielder at deep square. The fielder came in and took a low catch as it dipped a little on him but he had it covered. Markram had managed to miss the fielder earlier in the over but not this time. The lack of timing didn't help Markram. Huge wicket for the visitors. Rohit Sharma was elated as he knew how Markram can be a big thorn for them. B1$

formatValue: Markram c Hrithik Shokeen b Green 22(17) [4s-1 6s-1]

commText: Green to Mayank, B0$, that angled down leg and has been wided after some drama. The keeper went up after the batter missed the pull. B1$ Umpire had called it as a wide. They first checked for an edge and then for a snick off the pads. There was nothing...only a wide
Green to Markram, B0$, thumped! Short ball, Markram gets on top of the ball and smashes it. The batter managed it evade the man at deep square to get it for a four. Landed just short
Chawla to Markram, 2 runs, gets that away wide of long-on and races back for a duo of runs. Excellent running indeed as the throw came in at the batter's end. But he was easily in
Chawla to Mayank, B0$, straight down the ground for a four! Chips down the track, gets to the pitch of the ball and lofts it over the bowler's head. Lovely flat hit
Hrithik Shokeen to Markram, B0$, better from Markram. This pair cannot allow Shokeen to bowl quiet overs. Markram shimmies down, gets to the pitch of the ball and lofts it over the mid-wicket fence

Behrendorff to Mayank, B0$, neatly done! Angled across off and Mayank uses that to his advantage, opens the bat face and runs it behind square on the off-side, splitting backward point and short third with precision

Meredith to Mayank, B0$, will that get Mayank going? SRH in desperate need of a partnership. Slower ball but Meredith strays onto the pads, Mayank flicks it over backward square and clears the rope rather comfortably

Behrendorff to Tripathi, B0$ Caught by Ishan Kishan!! Second wicket for Behrendorff. This is turning into an excellent start for Mumbai with the ball. A nothing shot from Tripathi. Good length ball around off, Tripathi does not move his feet and has a tentative poke, the outside edge goes to the right of Kishan and he makes no mistake. Seemed like Tripathi once again wanted to run it down to third man and got the edge instead. B1$

formatValue: Tripathi c Ishan Kishan b Behrendorff 7(5) [4s-1]

commText: Arjun Tendulkar to Tripathi, B0$, neatly done! Short and angled across, Tripathi backs away a tad and guides it behind square on the off-side, splitting backward point and short third perfectly

Behrendorff to Harry Brook, B0$ Caught by Suryakumar Yadav!! Behrendorff has the big wicket. The orange in the crowd are stunned. The centurion from last game is gone early. Was that a set up from Behrendorff? Fed him a length ball and then went short into the pitch, Brook goes for the pull but the ball gets big on him, hits the splice of the bat and balloons straight up, SKY runs in from cover and hangs on. B1$

formatValue: Harry Brook c Suryakumar Yadav b Behrendorff 9(7) [4s-2]

commText: Behrendorff to Harry Brook, B0$, fabulous shot! This is high quality from Brook. Nothing much wrong with the delivery. Good length ball had a bit of width, Brook does not move his feet much but drives on the up through cover. All hand-eye cooardination there

Arjun Tendulkar to Harry Brook, B0$, there goes Brook. He puts on his skates and shimmies down, gives himself room to free his hands and smacks this over the off-side field, one bounce and over the ropes
